questions.question: In a two-degree-of-freedom system, the degrees of freedom refer to:

answers.a: The number of wheels on the vehicle
answers.b: The number of springs in the suspension
answers.c: The number of independent motion modes
answers.d: The number of gears in the transmission

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of a two-degree-of-freedom system in an automobile?
The natural frequency of a two-degree-of-freedom system is determined by:

answers.c: Damping coefficient of the shock absorbers

questions.question: In a two-degree-of-freedom system, the primary motion mode is usually associated with:
The purpose of anti-roll bars in a two-degree-of-freedom system is to:

answers.b: Limit lateral body roll during cornering
